node.title: The man who sparked a three-day lockdown pleads guilty over quarantine breach
node.alt: A man carries a bag and leaves the back of a police car.
node.description: A New South Wales man who caused a snap three-day lockdown in southern Tasmania pleads guilty to lying to authorities and leaving quarantine without permission.
node.content:
["A New South Wales man who caused a snap three-day lockdown in southern Tasmania has pleaded guilty to lying to authorities and leaving quarantine without permission.", "Timothy Andrew Gunn appeared in the Hobart Magistrates Court on Monday afternoon charged with making false statements to authorities, failing to follow the directions of an emergency worker and multiple breaches of a family violence order.", "The court heard the 31-year-old had twice had his application to enter Tasmania rejected but proceeded to fly in via Melbourne.", "He lied to authorities saying he had spent the past 14 days in Queensland, had flown in Melbourne that morning and not left the airport.", "The court heard that the biosecurity officer who conducting checks noted the man appeared nervous, was talking fast, shaking and appeared to be under influence of drugs.", "When he was asked to prove how he had arrived in Tasmania, Gunn would not make eye contact and stumbled when answering the question.", "Further checks found his application to enter Tasmania had previously been rejected and he had a history of offending in New South Wales and Queensland.", "", "
Tim Gunn, the 31-year-old man who breached hotel quarantine in Hobart and sparked a three-day lockdown. Date unknown.(Facebook: Tim Gunn\u00a0)
", "Gunn was informed he would need to quarantine with officers reassuring him it was \"not personal\".", "During that conversation, the court heard, he made several admissions, confirming he had been in New South Wales all 14 days before\u00a0entering Tasmania.", "He was told he would be completing his quarantine at the Travelodge hotel in Hobart and told not to leave the\u00a0hotel unless authorities said to do so. Gunn said he understood.", "The court heard that on the bus to the hotel,\u00a0Gunn\u00a0had a short conversation with the bus driver and indicated he was not happy about going into quarantine.", "", "
Security was increased in the wake of Gunn's escape from the Travelodge Hotel.(ABC News: Maren Preuss)
", "The bus driver then overheard a phone call in which Gunn said he would not be in quarantine for long and asked the woman to meet him there.", "Gunn was handed over to quarantine staff about 9:20pm. Sometime soon after he left the hotel.", "The court heard Gunn was found by police the next day at a residence in Bridgewater. He initially denied who he was, but eventually identified himself.", "A COVID test returned a positive but low reading, meaning it was inconclusive. The following day he returned a positive result and was transferred to the Fountainside Hotel in Hobart.", "When he was interviewed by authorities, he lied to them about where he had been after leaving the hotel, saying he had gone straight to the house in Bridgewater and remained there with only his partner until arrested by police.", "Police, however, had obtained evidence that he had been at a Woolworths supermarket, and when he was arrested at the house, there were four other people present.", "\"It also caused the director of public health to order a three-day lock down in southern Tasmania with the condition of wearing masks for seven days from that date.\"", "", "
Why we hear about some COVID-19 variants more than others
"]
